Analyze these connections for patterns indicative of accessing mapping services, public databases, or reconnaissance infrastructure.

Unusual process creation or file access.Action: Analyze Windows Event ID 4688 (Process Creation) on endpoints, focusing on activities occurring shortly after the arrival of emails containing location-related keywords. Look for suspicious processes being launched or unusual access attempts to files or folders containing sensitive location or infrastructure documentation. Use time series analysis to identify anomalous event timing.

Analyze frequency and volume of connections per user/host. Use frequency analysis (e.g., count per user per day/week) to identify users/hosts exhibiting unusually high interaction with these service types compared to baseline activity.

Access attempts to sensitive internal fi.Action: Configure SACL auditing on sensitive files/folders related to physical locations (e.g., directories containing blueprints, emergency plans, asset registers, network maps). Monitor Windows Event IDs 4656 (Handle Operation Request) and 4663 (File Access) for access attempts to these resources. Correlate access events with user accounts. Use statistical analysis (e.g., calculating the number of unique files accessed per user per day, or the rate of access events) to identify users or hosts accessing an unusual volume or type of sensitive location-related files.
